dialogues.text: Right here.  "Albert Lucas Trumbo."  And all the others.  I knew them all.  So did you.  We went to school with most of them. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't seem right, this being down here.  It ought to be where people can see it. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they commissioned it, no one could ever agree on where to put it.  The Methodists wanted it in front of the Methodist Church, the Presbyterians wanted it in front of the Presbyterian Church, the city council wanted it in the lobby of City Hall.  Everyone finally got tired of the fighting.  So they stuck it down here. He looks at her for a long moment.  There's an electricit between them, and they both feel it. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're really gonna be a lawyer? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive) And why not? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sorry.  You don't know how many times I've heard that.  "A lady lawyer?  Are you crazy?"  Like a woman couldn't be as good a lawyer as a man.  Or better, in fact. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you always wanted to be a lawyer? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... don't remember, but yes, ever since I was a little girl. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did... what did I want to be? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Oh, well... I guess you... in high school, you were a pretty good first baseman.  And we were on the debate team together.  But... I think you were gonna run the Bijou.  You were brought up there, and you loved it so much.  And I think you knew how much the town needed a place like that. He turns away, rubs his head. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish I could remember some of this. He turns back to her. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a boyfriend or anyone... you know... like that? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was married.  For four years.  But... well, we didn't fit together.  I'm divorced now. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.  See, when two people belong together, the other person should be the... the key that unlocks the rest of you... I'm not making sense, am I? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward her) No, you are.  I know exactly what you mean.  It's not that you're missing something.  It's that the other person gives something to you... that you had all the time.  You just didn't see it until they came along. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yeah... Pause. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in love... weren't we? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes. (then:) Hic! She instantly covers her mouth, but it's no good.  She ha the hiccups again. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  (hic!) LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the... ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm (hic!) fine.  Really.  (hic!) Luke smiles and watches Adele as she makes the decision t not struggle against the hiccups.  She has them, and that just the way it is. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were we going to get married? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually.  We were going to be (hic!) engaged... when you came back from (hic!) overseas... He looks at her.  She's strikingly beautiful at this particular moment and in this particular light -- hiccups all.  He moves closer to her.  She moves closer to him. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) ... but you had to go... serve (hic!) your country... They kiss passionately.  She reaches up and puts her arms around him.  He starts kissing her neck, and she suddenly realizes -- she's stopped hiccuping. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... it worked. And as she smiles and kisses him again we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke comes down the street and heads for the front door. has a definite spring in his step as he pulls out his key and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very dark.  Luke is about to swing shut the heavy do when he looks down and sees

dialogues.speaker: THE ORANGE TABBY CAT
dialogues.text: shoot into the lobby, stopping in the middle of the floor It looks at Luke, and PURRS. Luke closes the door and moves to the cat.  He crouches d and pets it, and its back rises to meet his hand. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fella.  So you live here, too, huh?  How come Harry didn't mention that? The cat moves to the auditorium door, pausing to look bac Luke.  Curiosity piqued, Luke follows the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dim light, we SEE an old mop and pail, some dirty cans, and a large beat-up cardboard standee of "The Tramp with the legend, "Chaplin Short To-Day." The cat comes around a corner and disappears through a do at the end of a hallway.  Luke, following the cat, comes around the same corner and looks at THE DOOR. Slightly ajar, there's a light coming from within, as wel the sound of Old Tim softly humming "It's a Long Way to Tipperary." Luke moves to the door and knocks. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Old Tim?  Sorry, it's late.  It's Luke.  Can I come in? The humming stops, and after a moment, the door swings op revealing Old Tim, a pipe in his mouth, holding the cat, stroking its fur. OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found me. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I hope you don't mind.  I didn't know anyone lived here... well, besides Harry.  And me. Old Tim moves into the room and gestures for Luke to foll him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is lit by a small table lamp next to the neat co which is perfectly made, military-style. OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not used to visitors. (gesturing) Sit. Old Tim points to a ragged, overstuffed easy chair next t the "kitchen" area -- a sink, dishes and utensils, a tiny icebox. Luke sits in the chair, and Old Tim sits on the cot, faci him.  Silence.  Luke glances up at a photo atop the burea

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: It's a much younger Old Tim, looking quite serious and handsome in his Great War doughboy's uniform. The cat jumps down from Old Tim's arms and moves to Luke. rubs against his legs, purring.  Luke leans down to pet h LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess this fellow belongs to you.  What's his name? OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat.  That's simple.  I like it. (pets Cat) Hi, Cat. OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden change-of-subject) We thought you was dead, you know. (another new thought) It's okay that I live here? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Pause, then suddenly. OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'll get me a new u-u uniform? Luke looks up at the old man, who stammers when he speaks more than a couple of words. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do everything I can. Old Tim puffs on his pipe, strangely detached. OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-t-thank you.  Thank you.  I... I always... I always wanted to wear my uniform from the Great War, but your daddy, he always said no, that's not an usher's u-u-uniform, that's an army uniform and the Bijou, she's not the army.  They give me a medal, but I lost it in the h-h-hospital.  I forget things sometimes.  Since the w-w-war. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty typical bachelor's apartment.  The "SAND PIRATES" poster leans up against a chair.  Pete's two box of belongings from the studio are on the coffee table, th empty bottle of Jack Daniels on top. There's an insistent KNOCK at the door. MAN'S VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Appleton?  Mr. Appleton?  You in there?  This is the Super, I have the master key and I'm coming in! We HEAR the key in the lock and the door swings open, revealing the building SUPER, 50s.  Behind him is Leo Kubelsky.  They enter the room, and the Super sniffs the LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell gas? SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't smell nothin'.  He must not be dead in here. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's the best way to tell. Leo moves to the boxes and rummages through them.  He pic up the empty bottle, examines it. SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's drunk somewhere? LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Wouldn't blame him if he was. SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, his rent's past due and he said to call you in case of an emergency.  He lose his job or somethin'? LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out his folding money) What's his rent? SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty a month. Leo peels off a hundred-dollar bill. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's three months rent, and a ten spot for no more questions and to keep an eye on his place.  Now, I need a moment alone. SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining the bill) Huh? LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a hike.  Am-scray. SUPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Oh, sure.  Just pull the door shut when you leave. The Super exits and Leo crosses to the phone and dials "O LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Police department.  I want to report a missing person.

dialogues.speaker: ON A DOOR
dialogues.text: It reads: "OFFICE OF THE MAJORITY COUNSEL - MR. ELVIN CLY AGENT WALTER SAUNDERS and AGENT STEVEN BRETT, both 30s an men to the core, hustle into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELVIN CLYDE is 35, a small, thin-lipped, reptilian man in Roy Cohn mold.  He's on the phone at the moment. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You say you know nothing about it.  You say this, yet you offer no proof.  How am I supposed to believe you? Clyde's SECRETARY knocks on the door, sticks her head in. SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Clyde?  Agents Saunders and Brett need to see you. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the phone) You do see that I'm busy, do you not? SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Appleton. Clyde's eyes brighten. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to come in. (into phone) I'll have to call you back.  I love you too, Mother. Saunders and Brett stride into the office. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a situation developing... CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Will you take those goddamn hats off? They stop, shuck off their hats.  Saunders starts over ag SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a situation developing out on the coast.  Appleton's just been reported missing. Clyde grins darkly. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good.  This is very good. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Angeles Police Department investigated.  His car's missing.  No signs of forced entry or struggle at his apartment. Clyde considers this for a beat, then: CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are on this as of now.  Tell the LAPD their investigation has been federalized on my order.  You find me this Appleton. (leans back, smiling) I want to see what this one has to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is sitting at the desk, making notes and adding up s figures.  He puts his pencil down and rubs his eyes, then looks up at

dialogues.speaker: HARRY AND OLD TIM
dialogues.text: who are sitting on the floor, going through piles of lobb cards and folded one-sheets like little boys fascinated w their baseball cards. He shifts his gaze to

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TERWILLIGER
dialogues.text: who is straightening out and dusting the tops of the two three file cabinets in the corner of the office.  As she works, she hums an old song, occasionally breaking into t lyrics: MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings) "The object of my affection, Can change my complexion, From white to rosy red..." Luke takes a breath: LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between a new screen, paint, plumbing for the concession stand, and about a hundred other repairs around the theater... it's going to cost at least nine hundred dollars to get the Bijou into shape to open up. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Nine hundred... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have sixty-eight dollars and thirty-seven cents in the bank.  Your only source of income are my veteran's death benefit of forty dollars a month, to which you're no longer entitled since I'm alive, and these ten dollar a month cash deposits you make.  What are those? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at Old Tim) They're... OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my r-r-rent. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all my fault.  I was neglectful and this is the price of that. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's true.  Wanting to open this place back up.  It's folly, Irene, pure and simple.  Might as well just call it what it is. Off everyone's worried looks, we

dialogues.speaker: A TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: It's tiny, with rounded corners, black-and-white, and a hopeless chaos of horizontal bars and snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc Lardner is fiddling with a brand-new console televisi set, trying vainly to tune in a clear picture of "Your Sh of Shows."  He adjusts the dials, fiddles with the rabbit ears, steps back -- and is successful.  SID CAESAR And IMOGENE COCA are involved in an elaborate pantomime sketc and Lardner fairly roars with laughter. He turns to go back to his chair, but the second he does the reception goes haywire.  He returns to the spot in fr of the TV, and the picture is perfect again. The DOORBELL RINGS.  He's torn -- if he moves, the pictur will break up.  The doorbell RINGS again, and we HEAR Ade voice from upstairs: ADELE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, that's Luke, can you let him in?  I'll be right down. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I... I can't... it's the... There's a KNOCK at the door. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in) Oh, hell... He moves from his spot.  The reception goes bad, and he marches to the door. He opens it, and Luke is standing there, wearing a slight out-of-date coat and tie. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Luke. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Doctor Lardner. Lardner freezes, staring at Luke. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken from his reverie) Uh, no... just seeing you standing there, it reminded me... there's a word for it... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean the suit.  Harry kept all my old clothes.  Fits okay, but it's a little big. Adele comes down the stairs.  Halfway down, she stops suddenly and stares at Luke. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Awkward pause.  Adele's staring at Luke, Lardner's starin Luke, and Luke's getting nervous. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have worn the suit. Adele comes down the stairs. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... you were wearing that suit the last time we went out before... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and It's just... well, deja vu. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  Deja vu. Another awkward pause as Adele and Luke stare at each oth Lardner breaks it. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kids off to the dance? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming? LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not much of a dancer. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chidingly) Besides, Daddy's still trying to figure out how to get his new television set working. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it, a minute ago... He glances at the TV set.  The picture is suddenly crysta clear. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... ooooh, It's back. (encouraging them toward the door) Well, you kids have fun now... Adele takes Luke's arm and they exit, exchanging goodnigh with Lardner, who closes the door and turns toward the li room. S-l-o-w-l-y, he sneaks into the room, watching the TV carefully all the while.  The reception is staying perfec Caesar and Coca are involved in an intricate bit of busin and Lardner wants to laugh, but he's afraid to.  He stifl his urge, and heads for his chair.  Gingerly, he sits.  S perfect. Satisfied, he finally LAUGHS out loud and puts his feet u The picture goes completely haywire again. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele and Luke walk along, arm-in-arm. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is strange.  Do you feel it? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done this before, so many times.  The last time was so long ago, but it feels like yesterday. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Pause. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, everyone's so excited about the Bijou re-opening... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) It's gonna cost over nine hundred dollars to open the place, Delly. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Nine hundred... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and needless to say, none of us has that kind of money lying around. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a loan?  You could go to the bank...? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loan to a man who ran his business into the ground and his son who can't account for the last nine-and-a-half years of his life?  Not likely. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's got to be a way... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Have you got a cigarette? Adele stops. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start smoking? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tried to once.  It was pretty pitiful. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Adele glances curiously at Luke as we

dialogues.speaker: A CLARINET
dialogues.text: launching into the opening bars of "Don't Be That Way," a old Benny Goodman tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spencer Wyatt's big ban is comprised of a dozen or so MUSICIANS about Spencer's age -- except for the drummer, AVERY WYATT, 40s, Spencer's dad.  Though no Gene Krupa, h pounds the skins pretty well, all the while smiling proud as his son plays clarinet and leads the band. Despite the last minute decorations, the Square looks nic hung with multicolored paper lanterns and colored lights.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE AND ADELE
dialogues.text: dancing to the music, along with several other COUPLES. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding toward the band) They're not bad. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're not.  I'd say your investment was paying dividends. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in '37, you heard Benny Goodman play for the first time, so you went out and got a used clarinet.  You wanted nothing more than to be able to play like him.  You tried hard, but it wasn't long before it was clear that Benny Goodman would never be looking over his shoulder.  So you gave the clarinet to Spencer. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.  That was nice of me. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a hidden agenda, though.  See, when he was five or six, little Spence used to follow you around like a puppy.  Bothered the hell out of you.  But as soon as you gave him the clarinet... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he started practicing, and he left me alone from then on. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  And he got good. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding. They dance a bit. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, did you remember that, or... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  Just filling in the blanks. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Okay. And as they dance away, we

dialogues.speaker: ON THE REFRESHMENTS TABLE
dialogues.text: Luke is pouring two glasses of punch, while Adele is bein shyly admired (and having her ear bent) by two twin broth ALEX and CHARLIE MCKENNA, mid-20s. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the luckiest guy in town, Luke.  Delly's 'bout the prettiest thing ever come outta Lawson. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Thanks, Charlie. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Alex.  He's Charlie. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Charlie. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir, 'bout the prettiest thing we ever seen, ain't that right, Charlie? CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ala Mae West) Thanks boys, ya flatter me no end. The brothers laugh goofily. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she's doin' that movie star, what's her name...? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring his brother) Hey, Delly, what was that test you was outta town takin'? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called the State Bar Exam. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot! ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine that, Charlie!  A lady bartender!

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: Adele and Luke are slow dancing to "Thanks for the Memory LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you tell those two apart, anyway? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Charlie?  Simple.  Alex is the smarter one. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... pretty frightening. They laugh and dance a bit more. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dancing's very good. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never used to be.  You were two left feet on the dance floor.  Like pulling teeth to get you to do a little box step. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I must've learned. Luke dances Adele away, a slightly nonplussed expression her face.  The band finishes the song, and everyone enthusiastically APPLAUDS.  Spencer bows shyly, blushing slightly.  He nods to the band, and they bow before he motions for the crowd's attention. SPENCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Thanks, folks.  Gee, can you tell we never played in front of people before? The crowd yells "No!," "You guys sound great!," etc. SPENCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is our first time, and it's really all because of Luke.  I mean, it's because of Luke coming back that we're here tonight -- but I'm talking about this. He holds up the clarinet and scans the crowd until he see Luke. SPENCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Luke) When you didn't come back, I learned how to play this so I could remember you.  And now that you're back, well, I'll never forget you. (to the crowd) Luke gave me this clarinet, but he gave this night to all of us. The crowd APPLAUDS warmly. SPENCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay folks, here's Mayor Cole! The crowd APPLAUDS as Ernie Cole mounts the band riser. turns and addresses Avery Wyatt, on drums. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty proud of your boy, Avery? Avery smiles broadly and beats the KICK DRUM five or six times to register his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KICK DRUM
dialogues.text: ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you might have to find someone else to mix paint at the store, 'cause I think Spencer's got a big career ahead of him. APPLAUSE again, and Ernie waits for it to settle.  As soo he starts speaking, the crowd becomes totally silent. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know folks, here in Lawson, we gave a lot for our country.  A lot.  And we never complained and we never faltered.  And we never forgot. Ernie's voice cracks slightly with emotion.  He clears hi throat and continues. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never forgot.  And so when one of our own came back to us, I gotta tell you folks, it was like a miracle.  Luke, seein' you walking down the street, it was... well, it was kinda like seein' one of my boys alive again.  I think I speak for everyone here when I say that not a day goes by when we don't keep our boys' memories alive.  But Luke, having you back among us... well, it helps us keep their spirits alive, too.  God bless you, son. The crowd APPLAUDS.  Adele takes Luke's hand and smiles.  Ernie wipes his eyes and changes the subject. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, enough a'that.  This is a celebration, so let's have us a good time -- but not too good a time, 'cause I see just about every member of the city council here tonight, and we have an eight a.m.  council meeting tomorrow morning, and I expect y'all to be there!  All right, take it away, Spencer! And Spencer kicks the band into the next tune as we

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: Luke and Adele come over to Harry and Mrs. Terwilliger, standing at the periphery.  Old Tim stands a few feet bac LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you two get out there and dance? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, I... Mrs. Terwilliger blushes. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't danced with another man since Mr. Terwilliger passed. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was that? MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen-oh-nine. Harry touches Luke's arm. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, we're gonna go.  You two kids have a lovely time. Goodnights are exchanged, and the trio leaves.  Alex McKe comes up to Adele and taps her on the shoulder. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly, can I have a dance? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Alex leads her to the dance floor as Adele shoots Luke a little "help me!" look.  Luke smiles back and watches the dancing crowd.  After a moment, a man in a white suit and tie, ROSCOE FITTS, 40s, comes over to Luke and extends hi hand. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, you probably don't remember me, Roscoe Fitts, I'm the grocer here in town. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his hand) Good to meet you.  Again. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Ernie said, we're all glad to have you back. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I hear you and Harry are planning on re-opening the Bijou. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna try.  Place needs a lot of work. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only imagine.  You know, I spoke with your Dad last year about maybe taking the Bijou off his hands.  I don't think he gave it very much thought. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he loves the place.  It's his home. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, I'm hopping you can help him see the reality of the situation.  I'll come to the point.  I want to buy the property, and I'm prepared to offer six-thousand dollars for it.  And that's just for the property, mind you.  If you want, I'll leave it to you and your father to dismantle and liquidate the building for whatever salvage value it has, and you keep those proceeds.  I just want the land. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) That's... well, that's very generous, but if you've already got a store...? FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The days of the storefront grocery are numbered.  I plan on putting up a free-standing supermarket. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's an alien word) A super market.  Huh. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it over.  No reason to risk financial ruin for the sake of a crumbling old building. Fitts takes Luke's hand and shakes it. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to have you back, Luke. As Luke watches Fitts walk off, we

dialogues.speaker: ON SPENCER
dialogues.text: SPENCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last dance, folks! The crowd MOANS slightly, and Spencer kicks the band into "Moonlight Serenade," slow and easy.

dialogues.speaker: ON ADELE AND LUKE
dialogues.text: As they hold each other close and dance.  Adele rests her head on Luke's shoulder, her eyes closed.  Luke strokes h hair and sways her gently to the music. Luke looks toward the edge of the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Leffert is standing there, staring at the band.  Mabe comes up behind him and taps him on the shoulder.  She's asking him if he would like to dance.  Bob looks down at ground, self-consciously shoves his hook-hand in his pock and moves away, leaving Mabel standing there. As Luke watches and the MUSIC CONTINUES OVER, WE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Adele dancing... ... walking slowly arm-in-arm down Adele's street, up her walk to her door... ... kissing passionately on her doorstep... ... Adele going inside and Luke walking away, each unable take their eyes off the other... ... Luke walking the quiet streets of Lawson, smiling beatifically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke turns the corner and heads for the theater door.  He pulls out his keys and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's about to close the door, when he looks down and se

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: MEOWING at him from the sidewalk.  He holds the door open and Cat shoots into the lobby, disappearing into the auditorium.  Luke closes the door... and stops.  He HEARS something, and so do we.  Soft and faraway, it's a PIANO. The melody is soft, lilting -- almost a lullaby. Luke turns toward the music, which is coming from the auditorium.  The piano continues, building slightly in volume.  He moves to the auditorium doors and tentatively pushes one open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke enters, his face bathed in the soft, flickering, reflected light of THE SCREEN. The movie is "The Big Parade."  The old, decomposing nitr print is badly scratched and stained.  A young, beautiful Renee Adoree is bidding a tearful farewell to her lover, Gilbert, as he marches off to fight the Great War. Luke stares at the screen.  The look on his face is one o bewilderment -- and awe.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIANO
dialogues.text: The rickety old upright is tinny-sounding and slightly ou of-tune.  But it really doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Terwilliger is playing passionately.  She never take her eyes -- which are full of tears -- off the tattered screen, except to close them when she is overcome with emotion.  Even so, she never misses a beat.

dialogues.speaker: HER HANDS
dialogues.text: fairly dance upon the keys.  Stiff and wrinkled as they a they manage to elicit every possible fragment of sensitiv that the old piano can muster. Luke is moved by what he's witnessing.  This is the magic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the right of Luke, sitting in the center of a row, is Tim.  Stroking Cat, Old Tim stares at the poignant scene unfolding on the screen, pausing only to wipe his eyes an nose with a handkerchief.  He doesn't notice

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: who looks up towards the projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: A BRIGHT, WHITE, FLICKERING LIGHT,
dialogues.text: filling the frame.  We're looking directly into the beam light radiating from the projector. PUSHING INTO THE LIGHT, we get closer to the windows of t booth.  We come out of the beam and can just barely make the figure of Harry, framed in a small window next to the projector. WE CONTINUE PUSHING IN -- closer and closer -- until Harr face fills the screen.  He is watching the film; his eyes wide and moist, as though he's experiencing the magic tha unfolding on the screen for the very first time. The warning bell on the projector CHIMES THREE TIMES, signaling the end of the reel.  Harry moves away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never taking his eyes off the screen, Harry watches as th film comes to an end and flap!  falp!  falps!  out of the projector.  He kills the motor and cranks the carbon arcs apart, and the bright beam dies.  It's not the end of the movie, but it is the end of the only fragment they have. Harry moves to the house lights rheostat, and slowly fade them up.  This done, he pulls a handkerchief from his bac pocket and blows his nose loudly. He crosses back to the projector, unlatches the full take reel and takes it down.  He's about to move away, when he senses that he's not alone.  He looks over the projector see

dialogues.speaker: LUKE,
dialogues.text: standing there.  Their eyes meet.  Someone should say something -- both men search for words.  Suddenly, Luke f very out-of-place, almost embarrassed -- as though he's interrupted a very private ritual. Harry senses this.  Clutching the precious reel of film tightly to his chest, he searches Luke's face and smiles warmly. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, wasn't it? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Yes. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, son, I wish I could've shown you more, but this is all that's left.  Just this one reel that never got sent back from a picture we showed here a long time ago.  Nineteen twenty-five, to be exact... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tiny laugh) Ha! LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, since you've been back, that's the first time you've called me "Dad." Father and son look at each other for a long moment -- searching each other's eyes.  Harry smiles a sort-of half smile at Luke, and, still clutching the reel, crosses to rewind bench.  Methodically, he mounts it and threads the of the film onto an empty reel.  Slowly, he begins to tur the crank, rewinding the film. He stops and looks to where Luke was standing... but he's there.

dialogues.speaker: PROJECTION BOOTH DOOR
dialogues.text: Luke is leaning up against the wall just outside of the projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: ONE LUKE
dialogues.text: As he closes his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY
dialogues.text: In bed, sound asleep, snoring.  A HAND reaches into frame shakes him awake. LUKE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry.  Dad, wake up.  Wake up. Harry opens his eyes and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bleary) Luke... what time is it? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-thirty. (smiles) I thought we'd get an early start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meeting of the Lawson City Council is in session, Mayor Cole presiding.  Of the dozen council MEMBERS, we also recognize Avery Wyatt and Roscoe Fitts.  VERA DWIGHT, the council secretary, a cherubic woman in her 40s, is readin the minutes of the last meeting. VERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Roscoe Fitts moved, and Red Curtis seconded, that the council form a committee to investigate the adoption of a new property taxation structure.  Motion carried, nine to two, one abstention. As Vera speaks, the meeting room door opens and Luke, Har Old Time and Mrs. Terwilliger slip inside and take seats the unoccupied benches. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Vera. Ernie notices Luke and the trio. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the chair notes the presence this morning of Luke and Harry Trumbo and the rest of the Bijou staff.  Frankly, the chair notes the presence of just about anyone who ever finds their way into one of these meetings.  G'moring, folks. LUKE & THE TRIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just guessing, but I bet it's not a sudden interest in Lawson politics that brings you all here. Luke stands. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no... (clears his throat) I wanted to thank you all for giving me such a nice welcome, and making me feel at home.  But I... we're... actually here on business of a sort... DALEY THORNHILL, 30s, the council parliamentarian, pipes He's waving a copy of "Roberts Rules of Order." DALEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point of order, Mr. Mayor, this comes under the heading "New Business," and this is not the time... ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can make an exception here, Daley. DALEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll need to be moved and seconded. Ernie rolls his eyes, then quickly and mechanically, with inflection: ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, motion to hear the speaker out of order. WYATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconded. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion on the floor, discussion open, discussion closed, all those in favor signify by saying "aye." ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opposed?  Hearing no opposition, the motion is carried. Pause.  Ernie turns to Luke and smiles. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, son. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Well, I'll make this short and sweet.  The Bijou needs a lot of repairs, and the truth of the matter is, Harry, um, that is, Dad and me, Mrs. Terwilliger and Old Tim, we can't possible afford them all.  So, I'd like to ask your help to... well, to scrounge around a bit, and see if you have anything that might help us out. WYATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinds of things are you talking about? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, paint, brushes, plaster, light bulbs, yardage, and if you can't come up with any of that, we can use some old-fashioned elbow grease. Fitts leans forward. FITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you do intend to fix the place up after all? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fitts, with all due respect, I think Lawson needs the Bijou a bit more than it needs a super market.  And I think Lawson deserves the Bijou.  There's not a lot that can be done to help us get past the pain we've all felt... He looks at Harry and smiles. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but I think a good dose of magic is as good a place as any to start. The council members MURMUR amongst themselves, then: WYATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Motion to encourage the citizenry of Lawson to help out the Bijou in any way they can... DALEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a subtle reminder) ... short of the allocation of city funds... WYATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) ... short of allocation of city funds. DALEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Seconded! ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) Motion on the floor, discussion open, discussion closed, all those in favor signify by saying "aye." ALL

dialogues.speaker: AYE
dialogues.text: ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing no opposition, the motion is carried!  Congratulations, Luke, you got yourself a town to help you out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the entire city council and the Bijou trio looks on, L moves to the memorial and pulls down the huge piece of mu covering it.  Harry steps forward and gathers some of it his arms. Ernie and Daley step forward and look up at the monument. Ernie touches the names of his two sones inscribed on the base of the monument. ERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) You know, this really ought to be out where people can see it. Luke overhears this last, and as he smiles, he turns to Harry, who brightens as he pulls a large section of the muslin taut between his outstretched arms...

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Harry's on a ladder, snipping the cords holding up the ol screen, which is dropping, bit-by-bit, into the arms of L and Adele, who are surrounded by a group of LITTLE KIDS, watching the goings-on in wide-eyed awe. Harry snips the last line, and the rest of the old screen drops down on Luke's head.  Suddenly... LUKE'S A GHOST!! raises his arms and plays the bogeyman for the kids, who scream in mock terror and scatter, as Harry and Adele lau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim and Harry carry a dilapidated row of seats up the aisle, as Adele and Mabel move in, tearing up the rotten carpeting and sweeping up the dust and debris. The men are having a tough time carrying the seats, and j as they're about to drop the row, someone rushes in next Harry and grabs his end.  It's Carl Leffert.  A second la someone else grabs Old Tim's end.

dialogues.speaker: BOB LEFFERT
dialogues.text: has a good purchase on the seats with his good hand and h hook.  He nods to Old Tim, who steps away, mopping his br Luke smiles as he sees this from the front of the auditor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Stanton and Mrs. Terwilliger, with the help of Ave Wyatt and his son Spencer, tear down the rotting draperie and scrape off the wallpaper covering the lobby walls.  T as Harry, Spencer and Stanton sand down the walls, Avery Mrs. Terwilliger hand them freshly-mixed cans of red wall paint and brushes.  Immediately, they all set to work painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is on the roof of the theater, pliers in hand and to box nearby.  He's just straightened out the "J" and he st back... carefully... to admire his handiwork.  For the fi time in a long time, the sign actually reads, "THE BIJOU. But not for long.  Luke tenses... the building starts shaking... and the train passes by behind the theater.  L lunges out of the way as three letters shake lose and fal Once again, the sign reads, " HE B J U."  Luke winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie Cole and Avery Wyatt stand solemnly at the front of small group gazing at the base of the war memorial, as it takes shape in a prominent place in the square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is on a ladder, attaching the final spring stretche a corner of the muslin.  It snaps into place, and voila - new screen!  Luke, Adele, Doc Lardner, and Sheriff Eldrid standing below, applaud enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As work progresses all around her, Mrs. Terwilliger has j finished dusting off the piano.  She opens the keyboard c and trails her hand delicately over the keys.  She sits, closes her eyes, and begins to play -- Chopin's Op. 10 Et No. 3 -- delicate, flowing music.  Even though the piano bit out of tune, it's still beautiful. As she plays, all the work slowly comes to a halt.  Befor long, all eyes are on her.  Everyone's listening.  Transported. After a moment, she stops.  Overcome.  Everyone applauds. Surprised, Mrs. Terwilliger stands, and, blushing, bows. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was beautiful. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taught you that. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can play the piano? MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all fluttery) Oh dear, yes.  You were an excellent student, before all that clarinet nonsense.  You loved Chopin.  You used to call it "heaven music."  "Teach me some heaven music," you used to say. She sits at the piano. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit.  Play with me. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I... MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of it might come back to you. Reluctantly, Luke sits down to her left.  As she begins t play a Chopin waltz, she encourages him to keep the 3/4 t MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good... that's good... But it's clear Luke has no idea what he's doing.  He's ju plunking bass notes.  But after a moment, the bass figure he's improvising start to change -- and before long, it's transformed into the eight-to-the-bar figure of a boogie woogie beat.  Mrs. Terwilliger stops playing, annoyed. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Luke!  That's no way to treat Mr. Chopin! She stands and moves away.  Luke keeps playing, grinning madly -- he's loving it!  After a moment, Spencer Wyatt r over and takes Mrs. Terwilliger's place, improvising the half to Luke's bass line.

dialogues.speaker: OLD TIM
dialogues.text: is tapping his foot to the beat.  He turns to Adele and s OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I taught him that. Off Adele cracking up. THE MONTAGE CONTINUES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and all the letters up again.  He steps back, checks watch, and like clockwork, the rumbling begins and a trai goes by.  This time, however, only the "J" tips over at a jaunty angle.  Luke smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke, Adele and Harry, wearing coveralls, sit at the coun devouring hefty plates of turkey with dressing and mashed potatoes and gravy.  Luke's and Adele's hair is practical white from plaster dust and Harry's face and hands are stained with paint specks. At the other side of the counter, Mabel is chatting amiab with Bob Leffert.  She smiles at him warmly, then turns t refill Harry's coffee cup.  Harry thanks her, then turns to the newspaper he's reading.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT PAGE OF THE LAWSON JOURNAL-AMERICAN
dialogues.text: Prominent is the black-and-white photo of a little boy an policeman holding up Pete's jacket, with the accompanying headline:

dialogues.speaker: JACKET ON SANTA BARBARA BEACH
dialogues.text: Hollywood Writer Feared Dead Were Red Agents Involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's standing near the sign.  He yells to Adele, down b on the ground.  She, in turn, yells to Harry, standing ne switch panel behind the candy counter.  He throws the switch... ... and the sign lights up beautifully!  Then, they all f the rumble -- the train rolls past, and, although they ra and shake, no letters fall.  A CHEER goes up from Adele, Harry, and the small crowd of ONLOOKERS below.  Delighted Luke takes a formal bow.  The boogie-woogie ends as we

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MEMORIAL
dialogues.text: Complete and polished, standing proudly in the center of square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a clear, balmy day, and the whole town is turned out Mayor Ernie Cole is at the podium.  He finishes his remar then picks up the two faded gold stars representing the l lives of his sons.  He holds them up, high above his head

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CROWD
dialogues.text: One-by-one, the gold stars of the town's boys are solemnl held aloft by their loved ones. Luke and Harry stand at the side of the square, looking o at the sea of four or five dozen gold stars being held al Luke catches a glimpse of a man in an army uniform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bob Leffert, standing with Mabel, looking very sharp his dress greens.  He brings his hook-hand up and salutes smartly.  Mabel takes his good hand, squeezes it as she blinks back tears. Luke smiles at this scene as Harry wipes his eyes and put his arm around Luke's shoulder, pulls him close and kisse him on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME
dialogues.text: The Lawson High School Marching Band is set up on the ste of City Hall, playing the "Star Spangled Banner."  They a being conducted by their director, MR. PHILLIPS.  Luke an Harry, hands over their hearts, watch and sing along.  Th Luke takes a closer look at the DRUM MAJOR...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DRUM MAJOR,
dialogues.text: a tall young man wearing an ornate brocaded red and white uniform with "LHS" emblazoned across the chest.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: He has an idea.  The anthem ends, and Luke excuses himsel and moves forward, buttonholing Mr. Phillips as he comes the steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Adele are on ladders, hanging letters on the marquee, which reads:

dialogues.speaker: GRAND RE-OPENING TONIGHT
dialogues.text: GENE KELLY AN AMERICAN IN PARIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry comes outside and gets their attention.  Grandly, h gestures toward the door, and out strides

dialogues.speaker: OLD TIM,
dialogues.text: wearing his new uniform -- it's the Lawson High School dr major's uniform, modified here and there.  "B-I-J-O-U" is proudly emblazoned across his chest in gold brocaded lett Luke and Adele applaud.  Old Time looks up at them -- AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim stands at attention, clutching the front door han Mrs. Terwilliger, wearing a new dress, her hair newly and perfectly coiffed, stands at the ready at her candy count ready to sell tickets and refreshments. Harry and Luke nervously pace the lobby.  Luke checks his watch.  It's time.  He shakes Harry's hand, and nods to O Tim, who swings the door open...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Immediately, PATRONS come flooding into the theater.  Luk exchanges surprised glances with Harry -- then walks outs

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE THEATER
dialogues.text: Luke comes out and looks down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of PATRONS stretches two deep down the block and around the corner. Luke smiles.  Success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's selling tickets from behind the candy counter whil Mrs. Terwilliger sells refreshments to a line of CUSTOMER Luke sells a ticket to a WOMAN, who moves away, revealing BOB LEFFERT AND MABEL. Luke smiles at Bob, who smiles back, his eyes now fairly dancing with life.  He plunks down his admission, and Luk hands him two tickets, which he takes with his hook-hand. Mabel smiles at Luke, takes Bob's good hand, and they mov away, revealing A FARMER AND HIS WIFE, 50s. The Farmer steps up and holds out a plucked chicken by it neck. Luke, surprised, jumps back -- then smiles, pulls off two tickets, and exchanges them for the chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only light back here is the light of the movie, spill through the screen.  Luke is straightening up the backsta storage area, when Adele taps him on the shoulder.  He tu and she throws her arms around his neck and kisses him. hands him a paper to read.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PAPER
dialogues.text: Luke angles it so he can read it by the light of the scre It says: California State Bar Association ADELE LOUISE LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has PASSED the State Bar examination. Luke, thrilled, grabs Adele and picks her up, twirling he around with joy.  He sets her down and kisses her passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is frantically threading the changeover projector. bell on the running projector DINGS! once, signalling tha the reel is coming to an end.  Harry looks out the window the screen, then back to the task at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke comes out of the office carrying a folded movie post With a satisfied smile, he walks through the lobby, admir how handsome the old place looks.  Old Tim, snappily atti in his uniform, is sweeping a tiny pile of debris into a dustpan.  Mrs. Terwilliger is straightening up the candy counter.  All is well. Luke goes to the lobby's poster case.  He opens it, and unfolds a brand-new one-sheet poster for "SAND PIRATES" - the same design as the one-sheet we saw in Pete's apartme Methodically, he thumbtacks the poster up and closes the case. As Luke passes the auditorium doors, a MAN comes out of t theater and crosses to the candy counter.  The door stays open for a moment, and Luke decides to duck inside and ca a bit of the picture.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The second-to-last reel of a black-and-white early-50's programmer.  It's nighttime in the desert.  A huge full m hangs over a B-movie soundstage version of the pyramids.  GREGORY, a dark, handsome leading man in a pith helmet is engaged in a fierce swordfight with KHALID, the villain. Pete takes a seat on the aisle near the door. GREGORY (ONSCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think you can win this, do you? Khalid lunges and draws Gregory's blood. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ala "Khalid") "Ha!  I'd say I was winning!" KHALID (ONSCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!  I'd say I was winning! Luke's look is "How did I know he was gonna say that?" Onscreen, an EVIL HENCHMAN is sneaking up behind Gregory. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gregory!  Look out!" WOMAN'S VOICE (ONSCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory!  Look out! Pete did it again. Onscreen, Gregory turns and kills the Henchman, then quic dispatches Khalid.  He stands over the body, catches his breath and says: GREGORY (ONSCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Rebecca. WOMAN'S VOICE (ONSCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead? GREGORY (ONSCREEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Rebecca.  He's dead. REBECCA, a beautiful American woman, comes into view and takes our attention because she's being played by Sandra Sinclair, Pete Appleton's ex-girlfriend...

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: His mouth is gaping open.  He stares at the screen. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Sandra...? Luke stands.  Confused, he stumbles backward, moving into lobby as the Man goes back into the auditorium with his popcorn and the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is staring at the closed auditorium doors.  Old Tim Mrs. Terwilliger take note of his odd behavior. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke?  Dear, are you all right? Without answering, Luke turns and runs to the poster case

dialogues.speaker: ON THE POSTER
dialogues.text: Forget the cheesy B-movie artwork.  As Luke looks at the poster, it's clear that he's remembering something.  He l at the picture of Sandra -- then scans down to the credit block at the bottom of the poster.  His eyes lock upon

dialogues.speaker: WRITTEN BY PETER APPLETON
dialogues.text: LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god... my god... no... Suddenly, all of Pete Appleton's worries have come crashi down on him... ... because he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warning bell DINGS! twice, but the changeover project carbon arcs keep sputtering and the motor keeps dying. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) Oh, baby, make your daddy happy... Harry's trying to keep the projector going, as the previo reel is about to end.  Given no other choice, he finally gives the changeover projector a good swift kick. It hums to life.  A perfect changeover.  Harry pets the projector. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good girl.  No matter what I say. As he turns away, he feels a sudden, sharp pain in his le arm.  Wincing, he grabs his arm, staggers back towards a chair, and sits heavily. He tries to clear his throat, but it dissolves into a hacking, choking COUGH.  He tries to stand, but drops to knees, clutching his left arm harder than before. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Oh, Jesus... Harry falls to the floor, and as he does

dialogues.speaker: THE FILM
dialogues.text: breaks in the projector gate... flap!  flap!  flap!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is still staring at the poster, lost in thought.  Offscreen, we HEAR the audience WHISTLING AND HOOTING in reaction to the broken film. Mrs. Terwilliger has been calling Luke's name, but he doe come out of his stupor until Old Tim comes up behind him spins him around... OLD TIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Luke! Luke stares wide-eyed at the old man. MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke!  Luke, something's wrong!  The film broke, and I can't raise Harry on the house phone! LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still dazed) What? MRS. TERWILLIGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to talk to them before they tear the theater apart! Finally, Luke pulls himself together, hears the audience noise, and moves toward the auditorium doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the shouting and tossing of popcorn and debris, Luke tries to regain his composure as he strides down the aisl toward the stage. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, folks, this happens every once in a while, just settle down... The crowd quiets down a bit.  Luke shields his eyes from light and calls up to the projection booth. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry!  Harry, why don't you cut the projector and bring up the house lights? No reaction.  Just the flickering beam of light. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?  Harry...? Luke, gripped by a sudden fear, rushes up the aisle and i the lobby.  The crowd goes silent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim and Mrs. Terwilliger watch as Luke tears into the lobby and makes for the balcony stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and charges between the seats and up the stairs to th projection booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke bursts in the sees Harry on the floor.  He rushes ov and kneels down next to him. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) The film broke... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know... keep still. A MAN pops his head into the projection booth door. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the man) Get Doc Lardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is in bed, eyes closed.  Doc Lardner has a stethosc to his chest.  He leans up and pats Harry's hand. He stands and comes over to Luke and Adele, who are near door.  Just outside, angling for a view into the room, ar Old Tim and Mrs. Terwilliger. LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty massive heart attack.  His lungs have filled with fluid, and, well... it seems as though his body is just... shutting down. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get him to the hospital? LARDNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we could, and the move didn't kill him, there'd be very little we could do there that we can't do here. (puts his hand on Luke's shoulder) I'm sorry. Harry's eyelids flutter. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Did you... did you... Luke rushes to Harry's side and takes his hand. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you... did you... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I what? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Did you fix the damn film?  It broke in the last reel. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Everyone went home.  We offered them refunds. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody take it? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closes his eyes) Vultures... Luke smiles. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not happy about this, mind you, but if I have to go, at least I'm going in my own bed, the same bed my Lily died in, and... knowing that my son is alive.  That's not too shabby, is it? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, I know about these things.  I've seen it before.  It's all right.  It's... all right.  You're here.  Oh, God, I love you, son. Harry smiles.  Luke kisses his hand and leans up, whisper in Harry's ear: LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you... Dad. Harry smiles faintly, looks at Luke.  He nods, then close his eyes. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh, so... much... lighter... Slowly, Harry exhales.  His face relaxes, completely at peace.  He doesn't breathe again. Luke looks at Harry's face for a moment.  Then as the tea well up, he leans over and ever-so-gently places a kiss o Harry's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful, bright, sunny day.  Luke and Adele stan the front of the large group of mourners.  REVEREND COLEM 50s, conducts the service. COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We commit to the earth the mortal remains of Harry Bernard Trumbo, safe in the knowledge that his immortal soul is at peace and at last reunited with his beloved Lillian in the bosom of the Lord.  Let us pray. Everyone bows their heads. COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want, he maketh me to lie down in green pastures..." Luke looks up at the sky, then steps forward and lays a single rose on Harry's casket.  Then, as everyone surreptitiously watches, he turns and walks away from the gravesite, toward the cemetery entrance. Adele watches Luke depart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and she's not alone.  Agents Saunders and Brett are watching everything from their car, which is parked nearb As Luke walks away, Saunders snaps his photo with a long- camera...

dialogues.speaker: THE BASE OF THE WAR MEMORIAL,
dialogues.text: and Luke's name inscribed there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stands in front of the memorial, head bowed.  After moment, he sits, leaning against the memorial.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUKE
dialogues.text: Lost in thought, he buries his face in his hands. ADELE'S VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I join you? Luke looks up, squinting.  Adele stands above him, backli the golden light of the sundown. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She sits next to him.  Tentatively, she touches his shoul He leans into her, and she enfolds her arm in his. Pause. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father said... that I would start to remember things. Suddenly, Adele feels as though she's walking on eggshell ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) What... do you remember? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... everything.  It started coming back a couple of days ago.  I remember everything now. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly.  I'm... I'm not... Harry wasn't my father.  And I'm not... I'm not Luke. She closes her eyes.  All her suspicions are suddenly confirmed. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adrift) Oh... Her tears start, and she moves to hug Luke -- but instead she starts hitting him, flailing, beating on his chest. hugs her tightly, and she completely lets go. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Oh, god, I knew!  I knew!  I knew from the start!  I wanted you to be Luke!  I wanted you to be alive!  You're so much like him, you have no idea.  No wonder everyone else accepted you!  You don't know what you -- what Luke meant to this town, suddenly being alive!  You don't know what this town lost!  You just don't know... She pulls away, stands, and looks him in the eye.  Luke rises. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing uncontrollably) I knew you weren't Luke!  And I tried not to fall in love with you!  And... I don't even know your name!  Oh, god... Luke moves toward her.  She backs away. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love with you, too, Delly.  Only now I don't know how I feel, about you or about anything.  I only think I know how Luke would feel. She's still sobbing.  He moves to her, takes her in his a LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly, shhhhhh... ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away) No... I can't... I have to... I can't... She runs off, crying...

dialogues.speaker: ON SHERIFF ELDRIDGE,
dialogues.text: making short work of a steak and eggs.  As he powers down meal, Agents Saunders and Brett, distinctly out-of-place their dark suits and hats, enter the diner.  They take no of Eldridge, and come over. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the sheriff? ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I got the uniform to prove it. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Special Agent Walter Saunders, this is Special Agent Steven Brett, FBI.  May we have a word with you? They flash identification, which Eldridge notes. ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) Please, sit. They sit across from Eldridge.  As Saunders speaks, Agent Brett pulls a photo from his coat pocket. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of days ago, a county flood control maintenance crew pulled a car out of the Lawson Wash ocean outlet.  They checked its registration, and when the owner was identified, they notified us. Agent Brett slides the photo toward Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: It's Peter Appleton -- Luke. ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, that'd be Luke Trumbo.  Looks like you boys've solved a little mystery we've had going on for a few months. BRETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, that's a photo of man named Peter Appleton.  He's been missing from Los Angeles for close to three months now. ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  No, there's got to be a... SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff -- this man is a suspected communist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Oh, and by the way, from here on, he's PETE again.) Pete sits across from Eldridge, Saunders and Brett.  The silence in the room is thick. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I under arrest? Eldridge glances at Agent Saunders, who stares at Pete impassively. ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, but these gentlemen would like to get some answers... PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else to tell you.  I wasn't hiding out.  I hit my head and I didn't remember anything until a few days ago. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that you remember who you are, were you planning on telling anyone your true identity? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriend.  If she still is... SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his notebook) Would that be Miss Sinclair? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic smile) No.  No, not Miss Sinclair.  I'm talking about Adele Lardner. Agent Saunders glances at Eldridge. ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor's daughter.  She was Luke Trumbo's sweetheart. Pause. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Appleton, I have reason to believe you're holding something back, and that just rubs me the wrong way. (pause) Sir, are you a communist? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) No.  Absolutely not. SAUNDERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  All right.  We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete comes out into the bright midday sun.  It takes a mo for his eyes to adjust, and when they do, he becomes awar perhaps TWENTY PEOPLE lining the sidewalk in front of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize several of the people.  Carl Leffert.  Bob Leffert and Mabel Lanier.  Daley Thornhill.  Katie Rutherford.  Stanton Lawson.  Now, there's nothing in the least bit threatening about the gathering -- and that's what's so disturbing about it.  They're not an angry mob, they're just standing there, running the gamut of emotion Shock.  Disillusionment.  Betrayal. It's an awkward moment.  Pete doesn't quite know how to react.  He wants to go over and talk to them, but he woul know what to say.  He wishes one of them would talk to hi just say something, anything.  But no one does. Then, Bob Leffert turns away from Pete.  He shoves his ho hand into his pocket and sullenly moves away, followed by Mabel, then his brother, then the others... ... leaving Pete alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Tim, in his doorman's uniform, stands by the open, em door. Mrs. Terwilliger, behind the candy counter, wipes up an imaginary spill, a full wheel of unsold tickets by her el Pete anxiously paces the lobby.  He looks into THE AUDITORIUM. Every seat is empty. He glances at his watch, then turns to Old Tim and Mrs. Terwilliger: PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's close up. As Mrs. Terwilliger and Old Tim silently shamble off, Pet goes over and flips OFF several light switches.  Most of theater goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete sits leaning up against the base of the dark sign. gentle breeze tousles his hair as he gazes up at the star After a moment, he HEARS footsteps coming up the ladder t the roof. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that? ADELE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Adele climbs onto the roof, comes over and sits down next Pete. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Pause. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure a lot of people down in L.A. are worried sick about you. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  I'm sure a lot more people down in L.A. want a piece of me. He turns to her. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Luke was a pretty good guy, wasn't he? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful smile) Oh, yes.  Yes, he was. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... let me tell you, I'm not Luke.  I know who I am now, and you don't.  And... I don't like me very much. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) You know, it's going to take me a while to get used to calling you Pete. (she takes it for a spin) Pete.  Pete.  It's a nice name. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I like it.  I think. Pause. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delly, I want to do the right thing. Pete can't believe he just said that -- but he did. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, I'm a lot of things, but communist isn't one of them. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you only went to one meeting, why does anyone care?  Besides, why should it even matter if you were a communist? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Delly, look at the country today.  We're fighting communists in Korea, we're paranoid about the Russians, we've got this thing with the Rosenbergs and the atomic bomb... (bitterly) You think they want "suspected communists" entertaining the American public with party propaganda like, gosh I don't know, "Sand Pirates of the Sahara?" ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about all that.  You want to do the right thing?  Then defend your name.  If someone says something about you that's untrue, you have to stand up and say so.  I know the law, and the law's on your side. Beat. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Delly? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, too. Pete smiles and puts his arms around her. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll stand by me? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happens. They kiss, and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a thick bank of coastal fog just down the road, obscuring any view of the ocean a mile away.  It's deadly quiet as gas station owner RORY, late 60s, pulls up and p his Model A truck.  He gets out, and an big old German Shepherd, LOTTIE, jumps out of the truck bed. Rory moves to the door, and is about to put his key in th lock, when Lottie starts whining, looking toward the fog and sniffing the air expectantly. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsit, girl? He stops -- he hears something, too -- a LOW RUMBLE.  Lot starts BARKING.  The RUMBLE is getting LOUDER.  Rory's getting worried.  He looks at THE FOG BANK. It's starting to GLOW from within.  Lottie's barking gets LOUDER and angrier.  Suddenly, a large black car punches of the fog bank and tears down the road.  It's followed b another, and another -- and perhaps a dozen more cars and trucks, all heading hell-bent-for-leather toward the town Rory moves toward Lottie, trying to quiet her as the cars past the station. RORY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh.  I know, Lottie.  This time, I thought it was the Martians for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is bedlam, overflowing with REPORTERS, NEWSREEL CAMERA CREWS, PHOTOGRAPHERS, you name it. A RADIO CREW is broadcasting in front of Mabel's Diner. REPORTER is on-the-air, hugging his microphone, speaking above the din.  Mabel stands next to him, his hand on her shoulder.  Bob Leffert stands nearby, grim. REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here with Mabel Lanier, the owner of the diner here on Commerce Street where Appleton often took meals.  Mrs. Lanier, tell me, what are your thoughts about having such a celebrated suspected communist in your midst all this time? MABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, its kinds hard to believe, 'cause Luke -- I mean Peter -- is such a... I mean, since he's been back, I've never seen the town so happy and all.  It's like he gave us some... I don't know... some hope, I guess. REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she's referring to folks, is yet another bizarre twist in this story.  Not only is Appleton alive, but he's been suffering from amnesia and living here in Lawson, where, due to a startling resemblance, everyone in town for the last three months has taken him for one of Lawson's dead war heroes, Albert Trumbo... MABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a catch in her voice) Luke.  We always called him Luke. Mabel glances at Bob, who lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete is at the desk, staring into space.  Adele leans aga the radiator behind him.  The silence in the room is thic Across the desk from Pete sits Leo Kubelsky. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI can't arrest you, because you haven't done anything wrong. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a relief.  I understand they usually don't let that stop them. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However... you're gonna be subpoenaed to testify before the Un-American Activities Committee when they open hearings in Los Angeles.  Now, if you play ball and tell them what they want to hear, they'll clear you. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I won't be a communist anymore. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it doesn't make any difference that I'm not one now, and have never been one. Leo stands and walks to the window. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, don't get philosophical with me.  This is a game, but it's not your game.  You play by their rules, or they'll ruin you.  And they have the power to do it. ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it bother anyone that this is a perversion of democracy? Leo turns to her and smiles.  His tone is charmingly matt of-factly, not condescending in the least. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, don't kid yourself.  We don't have a "democracy" in this country.  The Declaration of Independence?  The Constitution?  These are pieces of paper with signatures on 'em.  And you know what a piece of paper with a signature is?  It's a contract.  And you know what a contract is?  Something that can be re-negotiated at any time.  It just so happens that the House Un-American Activities Committee is re- negotiating the contract this time around. Leo takes out a cigarette, lights it. LEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, it might be the FBI.  The time after that, it might be the President.  But it'll always be someone.  Count on it. PETE
